title: Robert Evans, film producer and studio boss with a hedonistic private life whose long list of hits included ‘Chinatown’, ‘Marathon Man’ and ‘The Godfather’ – obituary
text:
Robert Evans, the Hollywood executive, who has died aged 89, presided over a renaissance in the fortunes of Paramount Pictures during the late 1960s and early 1970s with acclaimed films such as The Odd Couple, True Grit and The Godfather, before his career spectacularly imploded.

His appointment as Paramount’s head of production in 1966 was an unexpected and high-risk move on the part of Charlie Bluhdorn, the bombastic Austrian-born boss of the studio’s parent company, Gulf & Western.
